assessment_meta.title: Workplace Patterns Assessment
assessment_meta.description: Understand your behavioral patterns at work - how you collaborate, communicate, and contribute to your team

instructions.intro: This assessment helps you understand your natural patterns at work. There are no right or wrong answers - just choose the response that feels most like you.
instructions.response_format: Rate each statement from 1 (Strongly Disagree) to 5 (Strongly Agree)
instructions.time_guidance: Take your time, but trust your first instinct. Most people complete this in 8-10 minutes.

questions.text: I prefer to work on one project at a time rather than juggling multiple tasks
I get energized by brainstorming sessions with my team
When there's a conflict in the team, I tend to step in and mediate
I worry about making mistakes in my work more than most people
I enjoy exploring new ways to solve problems, even if they're unconventional
I keep detailed to-do lists and feel satisfied checking items off
I prefer written communication over face-to-face meetings when possible
I find it easy to say no when I'm already overcommitted
I often feel stressed about work even when I'm not at the office
I'm the person who suggests trying new tools or processes for the team
I double-check my work multiple times before submitting it
I volunteer to lead team meetings or presentations
I avoid giving negative feedback even when it's necessary
Small setbacks at work can ruin my whole day
I'm curious about how other departments and teams operate
I struggle to start tasks without clear deadlines and structure
After a full day of meetings, I feel drained and need alone time
I prioritize team harmony over pushing my own ideas
I need frequent reassurance that I'm doing a good job
I enjoy discussing abstract concepts and big-picture thinking at work

dimensions.name: Openness
dimensions.description: Curiosity, creativity, and willingness to try new approaches

interpretation.high: You're innovative and enjoy exploring new ideas. You bring fresh perspectives to your team.
interpretation.medium: You balance traditional methods with occasional innovation.
interpretation.low: You prefer proven methods and consistent approaches at work.

dimensions.name: Conscientiousness
dimensions.description: Organization, planning, and attention to detail

interpretation.high: You're highly organized and reliable. Teams can count on you to deliver quality work.
interpretation.medium: You balance structure with flexibility in your work approach.
interpretation.low: You work best with flexibility and may struggle with rigid processes.

dimensions.name: Extraversion
dimensions.description: Energy from social interaction and team engagement

interpretation.high: You're energized by teamwork and collaboration. You naturally engage with colleagues.
interpretation.medium: You enjoy both collaborative and independent work.
interpretation.low: You work best with focused solo time and may find constant interaction draining.

interpretation.high: You prioritize team harmony and are naturally empathetic. You're a strong mediator.
interpretation.medium: You balance team needs with your own boundaries.
interpretation.low: You're comfortable with healthy conflict and setting firm boundaries.

dimensions.name: Emotional Stability
dimensions.description: Resilience under pressure and stress management (reverse of Neuroticism)

interpretation.high: You handle workplace stress well and maintain perspective during challenges.
interpretation.medium: You experience normal workplace stress but generally manage it effectively.
interpretation.low: You may be more sensitive to workplace stressors. Consider stress management support.

sections.heading: Your Top Strengths at Work
sections.content: Based on your highest scoring dimensions

sections.heading: Areas for Development
sections.content: Based on your lowest scoring dimensions

sections.heading: Team Contribution Style
sections.content: How you naturally contribute to team dynamics
